citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An older male red fox was limping intermittently on his right rear leg and the left rear leg had an intermittent tremble. A
facility representative saw this limping on 30-September-2024 and communicated with the attending veterinarian then but
has not followed up with again with the attending veterinarian as the limping continued. The facility representative stated
the limping today was worse than he had noted in the past. Limping and leg trembling can be a sign of injury or a
degenerative disease that may cause pain or discomfort.
A male striped skunk has hair loss on the tail. The end half of the tail hair is thinned and the last ½ inch of the tail tip has
no hair present. The skin appears dry in appearance. The facility representatives state this is a seasonal issue, but they
have not communicated this change with the attending veterinarian. Hair loss can be a sign of disease that may cause
pain or discomfort.
The facility must have frequent and direct communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated by the attending veterinarian. This
red fox and striped skunk must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an
effective treatment plan.
To be corrected by: 11-February-2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An older male red fox was limping intermittently on his right rear leg and the left rear leg had an intermittent tremble. A

A male striped skunk has hair loss on the tail. The end half of the tail hair is thinned and the last ½ inch of the tail tip has 
no hair present. The skin appears dry in appearance. The facility representatives state this is a seasonal issue, but they

The facility must have frequent and direct communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate

red fox and striped skunk must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an

To be corrected by: 11-February-2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
